markdownRemark.html:
Callbacks

Callbacks are used to respond to state changes of a tween. A TweenCallback function delegate is invoked for each of the following events:

  • onUpdate: Invoked every time the tween is updated
  • onStart: Invoked when the tween is started
  • onStop: Invoked when the tween is stopped
  • onLoop: Invoked when the tween is looped
  • onComplete: Invoked when the tween is completed
  • onKill: Invoked when the tween is killed

üó£Ô∏è Assigning callbacks

Tween callbacks can be assigned with lambdas or normal functions. You can also use property chaining to make it easier in some cases. Tween callbacks have no parameters or return types.

// assigning callbacks with lambdas
tween.onUpdate = () => Debug.Log("Updated");
tween.onStart = () => Debug.Log("Started");
tween.onStop = () => Debug.Log("Stopped");
tween.onLoop = () => Debug.Log("Looped");
tween.onComplete = () => Debug.Log("Completed");
tween.onKill = () => Debug.Log("Killed");

// assigning a callback with a function
Tween tween = transform.TweenPosition(Vector3.zero, 1f);
tween.onComplete = SomeFunction;
